common_issues.title: Pieces OS installation and connection issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with Pieces OS installation, integration with other apps, and authentication. Issues include missing com.pieces.os directory, authentication flow errors, and websocket connection failures.  Reinstallation, checking firewall settings, and verifying Pieces OS version compatibility are suggested troubleshooting steps.

related_issues.title: com.pieces.os does not exist
related_issues.text:
com.pieces.os does not exist
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces OS: 12.1.0 Pieces for Developers: 4.3.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I installed UltraEdit on my Windows 11 computer (ARM), running Windows Home. After installing, creating an account, etc. I started UltraEdit and was looking forward to the integration. What I was met with was a window that said that Pieces isn't running with an error unable to determine Pieces connection port. After some discussion, UltraEdit team said that I was likely missing the file %USERPROFILE%\Documents\com.pieces.os\production\Config\.port.txt
Turns out I'm missing the directory com.pieces.os. I has not been created. I uninstalled all the Pieces apps and reinstalled from the website, hoping that this directory would be created. Now UltraEdit says Pieces for Developers is not installed and prompts me to Download Pieces. Clicking that link takes me directly to the page I just downloaded from.
I suggested to UltraEdit support that I could recreate the directory structure and add .port.txt, but they said instead that I should contact you. While you are looking at this, I am going to do a complete uninstall of UltraEdit and Pieces components, deleting any registry keys I can find (as uninstall doesn't remove any), and remove the .pieces_identites folder from Documents, then do a complete reinstall.
Looking forward to a solution to this.
Regards,
Ian Hannah

related_issues.title: An error occurred in the authentication flow.
related_issues.text:
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hello,
I am receiving this message when attempting to sign-in to Pieces.

```
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
Authentication Error ID: 00000000000000000000000000000000
```

This is a new install. (.appinstaller files)
I have never used the software before.
I do not have a pieces account (yet).
Environment: Windows 11

Launched the authentication by clicking the Sign In button in the Desktop App (4.2.1)
The auth link opened Firefox and generated the error.

I tried the following:
Disabling all extensions in Firefox
Changing my default browser to Edge and re-launching using Edge.
Re-installing with the .exe files.
Reviewed the windows firewall config (Pieces added it itself)
Looked at the Pieces log file but did not see anything obvious enough that I could solve on my own. (See attached)

[log-06252025-copy.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/20907036/log-06252025-copy.txt)

Thank you for the help.

Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces macOS app and Raycast extension update issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with the Pieces macOS app and its Raycast extension. The app update process gets stuck in a loop, and the extension is incompatible with recent Raycast versions, displaying error messages.  This suggests potential bugs in the update mechanism and version compatibility checks.

related_issues.title: Raycast Extension Incompatible with Current Version of Raycast
related_issues.text:
Raycast Extension Incompatible with Current Version of Raycast


### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Raycast Extension

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

As mentioned on Discord, it appears that the Raycast needs to be updated to be compatible with (at least) the current version of Raycast 1.100.3. Trying to use any of the extension's functions triggers an error saying:

> Your Pieces Raycast Extension needs to be updated,...

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/506778e6-5b13-4811-a21c-82c42384cb41)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces desktop (MacOS) won't update
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop (MacOS) won't update
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

If I start Pieces Desktop, it tells me it's out of date.

When I click on "check for Desktop App updates" the loader loads to about 40% on the icon and then restarts the app and I get the exact same message.
So it seems your updater is stuck in a loop.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App on macOS update issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems updating the Pieces desktop app on macOS.  Symptoms include the app reporting it's out of date, update checks failing or looping, and inability to update past workstream activities.  Issues have been reported across various Pieces OS versions. Further investigation is needed to identify the root cause and provide a solution.

related_issues.title: Workstream activity can't update last week tasks
related_issues.text:
Workstream activity can't update last week tasks
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I opened #753.
Now, Today's workstream is being updated but still I can't update last week activities with refresh button(select last week)

Is it good to think I can't revive last week tasks or I will be fixed?

common_issues.title: Pieces Core Services Fails to Open Due to WebSocket Error
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported a WebSocketException with a 404 HTTP status code when attempting to open Pieces Core Services. The connection to 'http://127.0.0.1:39300/user/last_checked_in/stream#' fails to upgrade to a WebSocket.  The issue appears on both macOS and Windows. Suggested troubleshooting includes checking Pieces Core Services installation, network connectivity, and firewall settings.

common_issues.title: Pieces Core Services Fails to Open Due to WebSocket Error
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported a WebSocketException with a 404 HTTP status code when attempting to open Pieces Core Services. The connection to 'http://127.0.0.1:39300/user/last_checked_in/stream#' fails to upgrade to a WebSocket.  Affected operating systems include macOS and Windows.  The issue may stem from server-side problems or incorrect client configuration. Check server status, network connectivity, and firewall settings.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the "Pieces OS installation and connection issues" as it has the highest frequency and significant user impact. Investigate the root cause of the com.pieces.os directory not being created during installation, authentication flow errors, and websocket connection failures.

Address the "Pieces macOS app and Raycast extension update issues" by fixing the app update loop and ensuring compatibility with the latest Raycast version. This will improve user experience and reduce support tickets related to updates.

Investigate and resolve the "Pieces Core Services Fails to Open Due to WebSocket Error" across macOS and Windows.  This appears to be a critical issue affecting multiple users and impacting core functionality.

Improve the update mechanism for the Pieces Desktop App on macOS to prevent issues with update checks failing or looping. Ensure clear communication to users about the update process and provide troubleshooting steps if needed.

Review and update documentation regarding Pieces OS installation, integration with other apps, and troubleshooting common issues. This will empower users to self-resolve problems and reduce the support burden.
